title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Language Microlearning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic language structures and fundamental terminology in specialized fields (medical/legal/technical)
context.additional_context: Language proficiency enhancement program for professionals to improve workplace efficiency

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze complex domain-specific language structures according to a three-stage cognitive processing model (sensory memory → working memory → long-term memory)
Learners can apply learning strategies that reduce working memory load by 40% using 15-minute microlearning content in mobile environments
Learners can transfer cognitive load management techniques (chunking, visualization, incremental learning) to real-world tasks with over 80% applicability through formative assessment
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
